p: (all trans)-9,12,15-Octadecatrienoic acid (linolenelaidic acid) is present in Turkish sage species, and the weight per cent of seed FAs of Salvia virgata, Salvia potentillifolia, Salvia recognita, Salvia tomentosa amounts to 0.4, 0.7, 1.1, and 1.4%, respectively [ 73]. Nicotiana tabacum also contains linolenelaidic acid but in a minor amount, which is 0.03% of tobacco seed oil FAs [ 74].
